definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to have a future full of promise

sentences.english: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
sentences.chinese: 树立远大的目标，不达目的誓不罢休。

sentences.english: Only those that are centers for some type of ambition do.
sentences.chinese: 只有那些成为远大理想聚集中心的地方才会。

sentences.english: The great ambition is spurring him on.
Sanhui people will march on further for greater target.
sentences.chinese: 勇于开拓的“三惠人”将目光投向了更远大的目标。

sentences.english: Your Business Master's degree will take you far.
sentences.chinese: 你的商业硕士学位会使你前途远大。

sentences.english: If you say Zhou Benchello has no lofty ambition, I could never agree.
sentences.chinese: 不过，谁说周奔驰没有远大的理想我敢和谁急。

sentences.english: If you say Zhou Benchi has no lofty ambition, I could never agree.
sentences.chinese: 不过，谁说周奔驰没有远大的理想我敢和谁急。

sentences.english: First, the mere idea of ambition in the factory was ludicrous.
sentences.chinese: 首先，在这样的工厂里提到远大志向是可笑的。

sentences.english: In the Jin Dynasty(265-420), there was a man called Zu Ti. He was a farsighted man with great ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 晋代有一个人叫祖逖，他是个有远大抱负的人。

sentences.english: He is a man of far sight.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个目光远大的人。

sentences.english: Excuse me, but would you perhaps be Mr. Kay of Great Expectations Company?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，请问您是远大前程公司的凯女士吗？

sentences.english: It falls to our generation to fulfill the great aspirations cherished by countless martyrs in the past.
sentences.chinese: 过去无数先烈的远大抱负，要我们这一代去实现。

sentences.english: This musician has a great future.

definition: to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
